summary: This is an email chain between a US Department of Justice communication technician and a SigNet Technologies program manager regarding a quote for replacement hard drives. The email shows routine procurement communication between the DOJ and a contractor.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Program manager at SigNet Technologies who is being contacted for a quote for replacement hard drives for the DOJ.

persons.name: Communication Technician
persons.context: US Department of Justice employee at MCC-New York who requests a quote for hard drives from SigNet Technologies.

connections.description: DOJ technician contacting SigNet Technologies program manager for procurement of hard drives.

events.title: Hard Drive Quote Request
events.description: A US Department of Justice communication technician emails Justin Houston at SigNet Technologies requesting a quote for replacement hard drives.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
SigNet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E
keyFacts: The document shows routine procurement communication between the US Department of Justice and SigNet Technologies regarding hard drive replacements.
The correspondence involves the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, which is where Jeffrey Epstein was held during his 2019 incarceration.
The email contains standard confidentiality disclaimers indicating it may contain proprietary information.
The document appears to be unrelated to Epstein case activities, focusing instead on IT equipment procurement.
